meanings.definition: A person or thing that froths.
meanings.sent1: The milk frothers at the cafe make the best cappuccinos.
meanings.sent2: The ocean waves were like frothers, bubbling and churning.
meanings.sent3: The frothers in the washing machine were working overtime with all the soap.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement was like a frother, bubbling up inside her.
meanings.sent5: The frothers in the blender turned the ingredients into a smooth mixture.

meanings.definition: Third person singular present of froth.
meanings.sent1: He frothers when he gets too excited about his favorite team winning.
meanings.sent2: The milk frothers in the coffee shop froth perfectly every time.
meanings.sent3: The dog frothers with joy every time his owner comes home.
meanings.sent4: Her anger frothers like a storm brewing on the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The river frothers over the rocks, creating a beautiful cascade.

meanings.sent1: The frothers soap created a mountain of bubbles in the sink.
meanings.sent2: The frothers liquid spilled over the edge of the container.
meanings.sent3: The frothers reaction to the news was unexpected and amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was frothers, contagious and bubbly.
meanings.sent5: The frothers mixture bubbled and fizzed in the chemical experiment.
